website_summaries.verdict: This study guide is not officially endorsed by LSAC, but it does provide basic insights into the LSAT testing process. Better in combination with other materials.
pros: Includes 3 LSAT-style tests, with answers and detailed explanations
Emphasis on time management and test taking strategies
Very concise text, easy to digest
Similar to compating study guide formats
cons: Not officially approved by LSAC, many practice questions do not appear on actual LSAT

customer_reviews.title: Okay for LSAT info, but not legit
customer_reviews.text: This is not an approved book by the LSAC, so it has attempts at LSAT questions, but no questions from an actual test. This leads to some incorrect question answers. This book should be used only as an overview to what the LSAT may contain, and not as a good practice test.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Farnum Cowley

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This study guide has been very helpful. The study guide provides a great writing style to help individuals, who have not taken a test like this, understand everything very easy. The one thing I liked most from this study guide is that it provides a lot of practice questions and provides detailed reasoning behind why or why not, a choice is correct. It does not overcomplicate information and is overall a great resource for prepping with the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Deneth Nop

customer_reviews.title: REALLY SIMPLE AND EASY TO FOLLOW THEY FLAT OUT SAID WHAT TO DO ...
customer_reviews.text: REALLY SIMPLE AND EASY TO FOLLOW THEY FLAT OUT SAID WHAT TO DO AND HOW TO PREPARE Really great customer service as well. It's really easy to chose a big book company but this book is just as good and cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great study and prep material.
customer_reviews.text: The breakdown of each the sample questions are really helpful. I gained a lot of insight from the different analyses of each answer choice and I benefitted from the diagrams and charts that help categorize the explanations. Overall, the prep book is an excellent prep test book that is helping me understand the test not just attempting to pass the test.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Valencia

customer_reviews.title: LSAT Study Success
customer_reviews.text: So far I am feeling more confident going into the September 2018 LSAT. This is the first LSAT book I have purchased and I keep returning to it for advice. Easy to understand and we'll organized for my learning style.
customer_reviews.author: C. William Purser

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a great tool in helping me prepare for my upcoming LSATS ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great tool in helping me prepare for my upcoming LSATS examination. I am normally a great test taker but some of the questions require a deeper thinking and I believe this study guide is a strong tool to assist in helping me achieve the best score possible on this exam.
customer_reviews.author: yajiara Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great study guide
customer_reviews.text: The book is great. Easy to read and comprehend. I like that it gets to the point and I find the questions challenging. I would recommend this book
customer_reviews.author: Judith I. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Practice Problems Not Sound
customer_reviews.text: Not too impressed with this prep book. The other guides I have seen seem to be more in-depth. Most importantly, I have been studying the first set of practice problems today and there are several questions with "correct" answers that I find very arguable. The "explanations" of each practice question's answer choices aren't adequate for these questions, as I am finding that the justification is often "this is clearly the correct answer choice" or "this is the stronger answer choice" without any explanation of WHY the logic/argument is stronger. Makes the process pointless. It almost feels as if the writers churned this out as quickly as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Material!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this book along with another one because I originally liked that it was short in nature. Starting a self- study regime can be overwhelming and this prep book was the perfect sized guide to get me started. The advice and tone of the book made this prep book easy to read and encouraging. It set as a study guide, or outline, for the rest of my studying. I felt like I could tackle this book in a relatively short amount of time and still get a good sense of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Ellard

customer_reviews.title: easy to understand version of LSAT prep
customer_reviews.text: You know how sometimes in school a teacher will give you a roundabout way of answering a problem that cold be explained so simply, but is instead made more confusing because of the wording? This book is the simple, easy to understand version of LSAT prep, while Kaplan is the teacher being wordy and overly complex. I have used kaplan study guides and test prep and this is so much better I can't even put it into words. The explanations are short and sweet and still manage to get everything in, and they give sample questions to drive everything home.
customer_reviews.author: Ajh

customer_reviews.title: There are better books than this.
customer_reviews.text: Full of typos, some sections and questions reference completely irrelevant things - like they copied and pasted from somewhere else in the book and didn't notice. This is better than nothing, but I recommend to try something else. Luckily I bought several books from different publishers.
customer_reviews.author: HistoricHomeLover

customer_reviews.title: Better off with another guide
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't use actual LSAT questions, and some of their questions and explanations for the different choices are poorly written. Indeed, one Logic Games question was so poorly written that it had no correct answer. Works only as a jumping-off point to acclimate you to the structure and question types on the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Ferver

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, better options abound.
customer_reviews.text: Its not an awful book, but there are TON of much better study resources out there for prospective law students. Save your money and take a look at the LSAT subreddit, there's a ton of folks who have a lot of experience taking the test and improving their scores.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Evans

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely useless do not make the mistake I did
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely useless do not make the mistake I did. The information within the book can all be found online and the questions are of no help whatsoever. Any good comments on this textbook are people who can't accept the fact that they just wasted 30 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Buy the LSAT Trainer instead, this book sucks at explaining anything.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my first ever LSAT prep book. Please save your money! These are not actual LSAT questions. The very abbreviated explanations for Logical Reasoning are not helpful and if anything, make this more confusing. Buy Mike Kim’s LSAT Trainer instead. This is obviously someone trying to make a quick buck. I threw this book away instead of giving someone else bad information.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Title of study guide: LSAT PREP Book
customer_reviews.text: The LSAT PREP Book was very helpful in orienting and explaining the strategies and test taking techniques necessary to understand the test content. The section of logic games was especially helpful and informing and it provided an understandable structure for answering confusing and complex questions. The tests were also very helpful. All in all, the LSAT PREP Book proved to be an invaluable tool for preparing for the LSAT exam. I would highly recommend it to students who preparing for or anticipating taking and LSAT exam.
customer_reviews.author: behr2

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad start but there are better resources
customer_reviews.text: This book isn’t a bad start to study for the LSAT. This book is too short to fully understand the test and over simplifies the logic games section which is well known to be one of the most difficult sections of the LSAT. Personally I would suggest instead of buying this book you should take the money you would spend and research a better guide, book, or resource and buy/use that resource instead. Some free online resources I used were better than this book.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this book
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this book because I just started to study LSAT. It consists of some explanations and examples of each part, but if you wanna study more deeply about each section, I wouldn't recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Haejin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good for those considering the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: This book is quick to get through. It was a good book for me as I was considering taking the LSAT. Not a good book if you’re already in-depth studying tho. Won’t teach and enhance your learning much.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Maciel

customer_reviews.title: Different style and small sample problem set compared to the real LSAT
customer_reviews.text: As the title suggests, this book formats problems very differently than the LSAT both in difficulty and phrasing. The sample problem set is remarkably small. For example, the Logic Games section only contains four problems.
customer_reviews.author: David V Chin

customer_reviews.title: Just an introduction
customer_reviews.text: 4 logic based questions. This entire book is an overview of the test and that's it. Some of the answers and their explanations make no sense even after I figured the problems out.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Kent

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time or money!
customer_reviews.text: I imagine the majority of these reviews are fake because this book is not helpful and the “practice tests” aren’t true LSAT tests. I also found several typos.
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: Awesome content
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing, it takes time explaining HOW to take the LSAT, many people don’t realize it’s not studying the content but the biggest part of studying for the LSAT is learning how to take it, methods of reading through questions and what not. Can already see improvements in my score!
customer_reviews.author: HollyE

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This book is ok. Do NOT get it if you need help with the Analytical Reasoning section. This is useless for that section. Overall, I prefer the study book made by the actual LSAC. If you need help on the analytical reasoning section I also recommend “Answers explained: lsat analytical reasoning section” by Jill Hacker
customer_reviews.author: Tara Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MATERIALS - A MUST for the LSAT Exam
customer_reviews.text: The materials are very thorough and I appreciate the way the book builds the foundation by describing the basics of taking the test, what to look for, and provides practice; all with hints on best ways to succeed. The materials are great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great study material
customer_reviews.text: Using this study guide has helped me significantly with the Reading Comprehension portion of the test, where I was struggling most. I have always been a good reader but it provided a better understanding of the material so that I could quickly analyze the material and answer the question effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Plantenberg

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This book is a joke. The questions are not actual test questions. You can get Superprep 2 and a book of 10 actual LSAT tests for about 10 dollars more and those books are actually published by the LSAC. This book has some decent information (maybe?) But the questions and answers are absolutely awful.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Thorough and clear
customer_reviews.text: This book deserves a 5 because it goes through the general contents of the entire LSAT, giving me an exact idea of what to expect and provides practice in all areas of the exam. The perfect primer before using their LSAT Practice Tests book.
customer_reviews.author: Writer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This book was very helpful in learning the format of the LSAT. Within a week, my practice scores have gone up between 5 & 10 points. The only thing I would say is to not overthink the tips: they are helpful but occasionally got in my head about what a correct answer might be.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Martiniano

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful and organized! But nothing about the writing section
customer_reviews.text: I found the study guide to be extremely helpful with giving general test layout and procedural information. As well as breaking down step by step instructions and tips for how to answer questions properly. The only suggestion I would make is to have a mini practice test at the end of the book that has mini versions of all three sections for more practice. Additionally, some tips about the writing sections procedures, even though it is not a scored portion. Overall, a well organized and helpful study guide!
customer_reviews.author: Sandi L. Kaspszyk

customer_reviews.title: Good price, two practice tesds
customer_reviews.text: Used this to study for exam. It was concise and offered good guidance at the beginning on question types and test taking strategies. Great for price!
customer_reviews.author: The Fair Critic

customer_reviews.title: Really Helpful!!!
customer_reviews.text: While I expected the book to be thicker, it was filled with content that helped me increase my LSAT score, so overall this is a great study module. Some of the wording was tricky but with thought, you could get through it. For the price, it is an amazing resource to have. The LSAT is already expensive enough so the less you spend on prep materials the better and this is quality for not too much.
customer_reviews.author: Madelyn Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is considering going to law school. This book helped to solidify his decision.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi Flippo

customer_reviews.title: Preparing for the LSATs
customer_reviews.text: The Prep Book has been very useful, comprehensive, and extremely informative, while giving what I think to be a thorough insight to what the LSAT will consist of and look like in test day. The explanations are very detailed and concrete, overall aiding me with a better understanding of the types of materials, various sections, and possible questions of the Law School Admissions Test that I have signed up to take.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Pongyesva

customer_reviews.title: Great Prep Book
customer_reviews.text: Frank and forthright, cuts through a great deal of unnecessary info I've seen in other books
customer_reviews.author: Dada510

customer_reviews.title: Great Help!
customer_reviews.text: This was a very helpful study guide and it has helped immensely.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great information to prep for law school
customer_reviews.text: so far what I think of it I like how they give me the answer, it's a great way to know if you are correct or not. but I try to take it more than once and then look at the answer the third time. so far I love this product and great material to use if you're going into law school as practice.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: Study tool
customer_reviews.text: Great study guide for my granddaughter to study for our pre-law exams
customer_reviews.author: Bev Taft

customer_reviews.title: typos and not enough questions
customer_reviews.text: so many typos and a couple of straight up wrong answers in the key. very light on information or practice questions
customer_reviews.author: Keyboard Expert

customer_reviews.title: I like how the study guide explains the different types of ...
customer_reviews.text: I like how the study guide explains the different types of questions and how to best answer them. It is also very helpful in how there are practice test questions and how it explains what the correct answer is. One thing I would have liked to have was information to help prepare for the writing section.
customer_reviews.author: Jeana Arbegast

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I thought the book was great. Really broke down each kind of question to the simplest form to teach you how to assess what they are asking. I like how it walked you through test taking strategies before you even took a question on your own. Great study guide. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: William Eissler

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful resource...
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking of attending, or are already gearing up to go, this book is a good resource.
customer_reviews.author: mrsamr4real

customer_reviews.title: Get this book!
customer_reviews.text: The study guide is helpful. It’s calming me down by explaining the whole process of the exam. I like the example questions and the explanations behind all the choices. This study guide is definitely preparing me to take the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: From the start of when I got this book I was impressed it was a lot less intimidating then some of the other study guides I have purchased and used. The practice test were exactly what I was looking for to get experience of what the test will be like.
customer_reviews.author: Katie D.

customer_reviews.title: Short and not copmrehensive
customer_reviews.text: Might be a decent secondary book, but pales in comparison to Kaplan. Missing a lot of essential info on strategies and question analysis.
customer_reviews.author: Bleggs

customer_reviews.title: Explains logic to me
customer_reviews.text: This book was easy to follow. I’ve tried understanding the test with Kaplan and Princeton review but I couldn’t catch on. This one was at my level of logic.
customer_reviews.author: MARISSA A

customer_reviews.title: I loved this study guide
customer_reviews.text: I loved this study guide! I feel much more confident about the LSAT and well equipped with strategies and practice. This study guide takes away some of the test stress!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There are several errors in the practice question answers and ...
customer_reviews.text: There are several errors in the practice question answers and explanations. The explanations don't always refer to the actual question or the correct prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Haberman

customer_reviews.title: Great Rescource !
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was a great way for me to be introduced to the LSAT and begin studying ahead of time.
customer_reviews.author: joseline

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed the study guide, felt like it did a great job giving me the tools necessary to score well on the LSAT. The lesson portion contained very good guides and advice on how to take the test.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Anderson

customer_reviews.title: LSAT Prep Books 2020-2021 is a Great Investment for Success
customer_reviews.text: This LSAT Study Guide is very user friendly and easy to follow. The practice tests were especially useful ! This study guide has been a big help to me. A great investment and very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: ATL

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This book is very informative about studying and test-taking strategies! I have never experienced a more helpful prep book, and having it makes me feel more confident about taking the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Kofi

customer_reviews.title: Probably Best LSAT Prep Guide Available
customer_reviews.text: Very accessible reading. Seems like authors are human and really care. Nicely presented in a comfortable to use paperback of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mom1357

customer_reviews.title: Great resource
customer_reviews.text: It contained so much useful information in a convenient and organized fashion. The tips I gained from it could not be all compiled in any other source, so well done.
customer_reviews.author: danalss

customer_reviews.title: Great Prep for LSAT's
customer_reviews.text: This study guide walks you through everything! It is well written, easy reading and gives helpful tips and testing strategies. The best part is the answer explanations.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The Product was great although I would love to see more certified and real LSAT questions from past exams.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: A must have for LAW SCHOOL.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book if you are working to attend law school. This book really help me understand the LSAT exam more clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Jamall

customer_reviews.title: Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Not only did it help me practice but it also taught me why my answers were wrong. Rather than just say it’s wrong, it explained why which is helpful. I feel more prepared because of this book.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Making my future bigger than my pass
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it’s the new year LSAT and that they break down all of the information as well as ways and techniques to master multiple choice questions
customer_reviews.author: Kyiandra Georges

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I like the format and the study schedule but the day spacing on schedule seems a little easy since it can be one paragraph for a day.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great LSAT prep tool
customer_reviews.text: I think this is very helpful in preparing for the test because I am getting a good understanding of the format of the test and of the questions that will be on it.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I think that it was very informative about the LSAT in general and it has really prepared me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great set of practice questions, I found the material easy to follow and rather helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful study guide
customer_reviews.text: The book has been great so far and helpful in breaking down the different components of the LSATs. I feel like I am really preparing myself. I truly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel  Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Really Prepares you
customer_reviews.text: I like this study guide. It offers tips for test day along with practice test to prepare me.
customer_reviews.author: Dahlia Baqer

customer_reviews.title: great book
customer_reviews.text: I like this study guide because it teaches you the must know information instead of over doing it which can make people overwhelmed.
customer_reviews.author: Cari Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Good test taking strategies
customer_reviews.text: Very comprehensive yet not overwelming. I do not have a lot of time to study so the fact that it is concise does help. I like the test taking strategies section. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne S.

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Amazing supplement! It won’t be all you need but for the price, it’s a must have.
customer_reviews.author: C-Train

customer_reviews.title: LSAT Prep Book
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to read and follow through. Love how each example is explained with detail and ease.
customer_reviews.author: Rene F. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: good book
customer_reviews.text: Well explained but need more concept building materials for who do not know much of logics.
customer_reviews.author: seonggu kang

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Preparing for the LSAT in November
customer_reviews.text: I found this study guide very helpful in preparing for the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: digadcote

customer_reviews.title: Getting  for my LSAT
customer_reviews.text: Great book to help me prepare for my upcoming LSAT test. Easy to understand and navigate.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Bell

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great LSAT study book! The practice questions really helped me understand how to go about taking the exam and it gave clear and concise examples of questions to look for.
customer_reviews.author: Shomahri Simmonds

customer_reviews.title: great book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book due to it covers everything with regard to getting to score higher in LSAT exam.
customer_reviews.author: Iftikhar Haq

customer_reviews.title: I would rate the product a 5 with my favorite part being how concentrated and easy to follow the ...
customer_reviews.text: I would rate the product a 5 with my favorite part being how concentrated and easy to follow the information was.
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: It is decent
customer_reviews.text: I thought the guide was decent, however, I would have loved more practice tests included.
customer_reviews.author: Sachi Desai

customer_reviews.title: Liked it
customer_reviews.text: Did it's job to jump start my studying. Not as big as I expected though.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry A. Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: The study guide was very effective. It helped me to feel confident when I took my exam.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I believe that I have learned the knowledge I need to be successful on the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: DavonneRahman

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: This study guide is an excellent source to have when preparing for the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful study guide
customer_reviews.text: Good study guide with plenty of practice tests and helpful tips
customer_reviews.author: Masarat M

customer_reviews.title: Great book to learn all the basics for the LSAT
customer_reviews.text: The book is a great source to help you build confidence when taking the LSAT
customer_reviews.author: Sujayne H.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I would like to see more practice tests included, other than that it was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: USE THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: It is really good, helping me a lot to be honest, continuing to study everyday
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Leone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I thought the guide was easy to use and follow along with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I just started the guide and believe it is good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Maryam

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this book because it explains what to expect on the LSAT and gives helpful tips.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great study guide!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a very helpful study guide. I appreciate having good 'Day of the Test' tips
customer_reviews.author: joshuwa

customer_reviews.title: Practice questions
customer_reviews.text: Useful practice questions and tests. Easy to read quide. The answers were well explained.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: It was helpful
customer_reviews.text: I think it makes it easier to follow along and understand the concept.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Understanding the type of questions
customer_reviews.text: It has helped me get a good understanding of the type of questions and how to answer correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great Prep Book
customer_reviews.text: I found the guide to be extremely helpful and comprehensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K

customer_reviews.title: I found the coverage of the different question types and ...
customer_reviews.text: I found the coverage of the different question types and potential pitfalls to watch out for thorough and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Garin

customer_reviews.title: Questions do not mirror the toughness of an actual LSAT.
customer_reviews.text: The practice questions have me a fake sense of pride. I was able to complete them easily after reading through the sections. Great, so I thought. The practice questions in this book are much easier than anything you would find in any other book especially the logic games. With that said It is great for a complete beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Callan

customer_reviews.title: This book is a great starting point for those who are interested in going ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great starting point for those who are interested in going to law school. It's easy to understand and not intimidating. At 140 pages, this guide highlights the main points in each of the sections, test taking strategies and time saving techniques but you'll need to invest in practice tests to hone your skills. Not saying this is the end all be all but this is definitely a good basic review and great confidence booster.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: I recently purchased the LSAT practice book. I give ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the LSAT practice book. I give it a 5/5. I thought it was descriptive and very helpful. The questions offered and the analysis of the answers help increase my understanding of the tes
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: but this book has been very easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: Normally Study Guide Prep Books are overwhelming, but this book has been very easy to understand. I have found it very useful for my pre law journey.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlyn

customer_reviews.title: Eh, it's ok...
customer_reviews.text: The part about how to access the test and the review of all the question types was helpful, but overall I was disappointed with it not having an online component where you can take a practice test. In the back of the book there are a lot of test questions, but not a full test. I would purchase this book based on the fact that I liked that it broke down each question type, but would also buy Kaplan so I could have a few more practice tests. Also, for a prep book by the LSAT Test Committee I would think that they would have a few better products out there like flashcards, practice test books, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha S.

customer_reviews.title: very useful way to study
customer_reviews.text: This book really did help me study for the LSAT, very useful way to study. The customer service is really nice and helpful. If you're looking for a good, successful way to study, this is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STUDY GUIDE
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed the study guide. I like that it includes practice questions and answers, and even as I read each section, I can't help but feel like I'm in a class room being taught from the book. I also appreciate the fact that there are various sections explaining each type of question in the LSAT. I will definitely recommend this study guide to anyone I know who plans on taking the LSAT.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Paredes

product_meta.title: LSAT Prep Book: Study Guide & Practice Test Questions for the Law School Admission Council's (LSAC) Law School Admission Test
